item.title: Time to move on FreeBSD
item.description: What is FreeBSD? First of all FreeBSD or any BSD is not Linux or its distro. According to freebsd.org - FreeBSD is an operating system used to power modern servers, desktops, and embedded platforms. A large community has continually developed it for more than thirty years. Its advanced networking, security, and storage features have made FreeBSD the platform of choice for many of the busiest web sites and most pervasive embedded networking and storage devices.
